places_with_reviews.name: Jesal Toral Samadhi

reviews.text:
Historical and religious place reflects anjar's rich and old cultural tradition.
Must visit place for tourists come in kutch.

Jesal Toral Samadhi place was very famous and historical place in Anjar. True love story of Jesal and Toral. The tomb is an excellent place to feel the thrill of love. Lunch and dinner Prasad served by temple. History lovers and researchers must visit this location.
It's devine place , where one DakuToral is worship due to his wife Jesal...one who visit kuchh must visit this place

This is the one of the historical place in anjar …. This historical place based on Jesal jadeja and Sati toral …. This feel place is very popular in anjar … also the market of anjar is very famous 👍🏻👍🏻

Place where you will mostly find people from the interiors of Kutch, resplendent in their traditional dress. Though the samadhi is not much of an attraction, the road leading to it is. Unusual items like swords attract customers.

places_with_reviews.name: Govardhan Parvat
places_with_reviews.address: near Ahir, Kanya Chhatralay Rd, Satapar, Gujarat 370110, India

reviews.text: Very beautiful place located outside of anjar. Can go with family and friends in morning or evening. A decent place with lots of work on greenery and emphasis given on cleanliness. Small ponds covered with lighting’s at night. Another side there a temple of lord krishna at the top, few steps to go to the top. Around this there a small garden, playground, animals and birds. Very calm and peaceful place, one can spend here 3 to 4 hours. No entry fees . Divine atmosphere with bhajans playing around in small speakers in the walk area around the hillock.
is this place so good and for a picnic with children and family .

This place is like a mini Vrindavan, complete with a cute little hill and a temple for Lord Krishna. You can either climb the steps for the full experience or take the elevator if you're feeling less energetic. Definitely worth checking out!
It's superb Temple of Lord krishna near by gandhidham. It's like open sky place and we get peace of mind here as well as it's small zoo of birds here. I visit here with my family. I really like it.
Best place for family, friends and kids

places_with_reviews.name: Veer Balak Smarak

reviews.text: This place is basically a memorial for the victims of the 2001 earthquake in Anjar. It is a nice place to visit and highly recommended to visit the museum inside.

This memorial has been made in the memory of the students and teachers of the school who were martyred in the earthquake. Gujarat Government has taken a good decision by building this memorial so that the public can understand the situation of that time. 180+ school students and 20+ teachers during a rally on 26/01/2001 when they entered Anjar's khatri yl Bazar due to a sudden earthquake. These children and teachers have been victimized. In the memorial, his name along with photos and his favorite things are preserved. Also there is a simulator that makes you visualize the earthquake.
Good place to visit one time.
Very good initiative and very creative approach to design a memorable museum. It's such a good experience centre to feel the emotions of 2001 earthquake. Appreciation to the administratives.

185 school children and 20 teachers lost their lives while going for a rally in Anjar of Kutch due to an earthquake that struck in the region in 2001. The then Chief Minister, Shri Narendra Modi, announced the construction of Veer Baal Smarak to pay tribute to the children who lost their lives.

This museum dedicated to deceased children is spread over five sections. The first section presents pictures of the deceased and memories of the past. The Destruction Section presents the memorials and replicas of deceased children'. A special room has been made to enable visitors to experience the earthquake in real time through a simulator and a video on the screen. Apart from that, the process of earthquake, its occurrence, scientific reasons and other necessary details have been included in the science section. In the last section, visitors are asked questions about their experience of earthquake.

A memorial has been built outside the museum with the names of the deceased children and teachers. Their names are written on the wall along with their pictures. A powerful Prakashpunj has been built here to pay homage to them. The light emanating from it will be visible in the entire city of Anjar.

places_with_reviews.name: Mahakaleshwar Temple
places_with_reviews.address: 32VV+9W2, Mahakaleshwer Temple Rd, Anjar, Meghpar, Gujarat 370205, India

reviews.text:
Makleshwar Mahadev temple at Anjar on Anjar-Gadshisha road. It is a temple of God Mahadev, the Shiv ling is swayambhu (self generated) and has its own significane, the one who with true heart prays and offers jal to Makleshwar Shiv ling gets all their wishes fulfilled.

A must visit place, it has wide area for celebrating and having havans and other religious functions.

Har Har Mahadev #Jay
